Before donating, please read this guide.

What are the requirements to become a donor?

1. In a healthy condition
2. Is between 17 and 65 years old
3. Weigh at least 45 kilograms
4. Blood pressure requirements:
- sistole 100 - 170
- diastole 70 - 100
5. Haemoglobin value above 12.5g/dl
6. Last donated blood 12 weeks or 3 months ago.

You are not eligible to donate blood if you either:

- suffer from heart and lung diseases
- have cancer
- suffer from hypertension
- suffer from diabetes
- have tendencies of abnormal bleeding or other blood anomalies
- suffer from epilepsy or seizures
- have a history of Hepatitis B or C
- suffer from syphilis
- have drug addiction
- have alcohol addiction
- suffer from HIV/AIDS
- belongs to a group identified at high risk for HIV/AIDS
- do not have permission from your doctor to donate blood

You may have to delay your blood donation under certain conditions:

- Suffering from Fever/Influenza (A week after recovery)
- After tooth extraction (5 days after recovery)
- After minor body operation (6 months)
- After major body operation (12 months)
- After blood transfusion (12 months)
- After tattoo/piercing application or transplantation (12 months)
- After close contact with Hepatitis patient (12 months)
- During pregnancy (6 months after delivery)
- During breastfeeding (3 months after final breastfeeding)
- Suffering from malaria (3 years after free from symptoms)
- After coming home from malaria-endemic region (12 months)
- After living in malaria-endemic region for five years (5 years after departing)
- Suffering from typhus/typhoid (6 months after recovery)
- After vaccination (6 weeks)
- After allergy symptoms (A week after recovery)
- After skin infection on area to be pierced by the needle (1 week after recovery)
